snippet.textDisplay: This is one of the 3 video games that gave me injuries, the other being a DBZ Budokai title that required the same control-stick rotating for charging certain specials, and of course, DDR. I derped a bit on that game. Ow.

snippet.textDisplay: One of the best songs for any of the Mario Party games. Definitely one of the most memorable ones as well. It ended up breaking N64 controllers and causing injuries.lol There will never be another Mario Party like this one.
snippet.textOriginal: One of the best songs for any of the Mario Party games. Definitely one of the most memorable ones as well. It ended up breaking N64 controllers and causing injuries.lol There will never be another Mario Party like this one.

snippet.textDisplay:
There's one thing I never managed to complete in this game, and that was the solo minigame area. I could never beat the tug-of-war minigame to progress and I remember tearing the skin on my palm trying to complete it. 

Still love this game, and it's music to this day.
snippet.textOriginal:
There's one thing I never managed to complete in this game, and that was the solo minigame area. I could never beat the tug-of-war minigame to progress and I remember tearing the skin on my palm trying to complete it. 

Still love this game, and it's music to this day.

snippet.textDisplay: Also, this was a good board in the first Mario Party. I only have 1, 2, and 4 out of all the games. I wish I didn't miss out on Mario Party 3 back in the day. I don't know how I never got that one. Overall though, I say Mario Party 2 is the best.
snippet.textOriginal: Also, this was a good board in the first Mario Party. I only have 1, 2, and 4 out of all the games. I wish I didn't miss out on Mario Party 3 back in the day. I don't know how I never got that one. Overall though, I say Mario Party 2 is the best.

snippet.textDisplay: I remember one night my friend, my brother and I were playing this and at the end of the match (a 60 turn one no less) there was a way (can't remember exactly how now) to get extra stars that the computer controlled characters obtained by unplugging and re-plugging controllers in different ports. My brother and I had done it several times before so my friend really wanted to try it and when he went to do it he hit the reset button. This of course caused him to cry. Ah childhood :)
snippet.textOriginal: I remember one night my friend, my brother and I were playing this and at the end of the match (a 60 turn one no less) there was a way (can't remember exactly how now) to get extra stars that the computer controlled characters obtained by unplugging and re-plugging controllers in different ports. My brother and I had done it several times before so my friend really wanted to try it and when he went to do it he hit the reset button. This of course caused him to cry. Ah childhood :)

snippet.textDisplay: Nostalgia with this one, playing with friends and having tons of fun. I remember the minigames that made you rotate the control stick really fast, I'd use my palm and get blisters because of that. A lot of people actually did that and Nintendo eventually got lawsuits over it from angry parents. I don't think Nintendo ever put those kind of minigames again in the sequels because of that, and it might also explain why they skipped this game and released Mario Party 2 for the Virtual Console.
snippet.textOriginal: Nostalgia with this one, playing with friends and having tons of fun. I remember the minigames that made you rotate the control stick really fast, I'd use my palm and get blisters because of that. A lot of people actually did that and Nintendo eventually got lawsuits over it from angry parents. I don't think Nintendo ever put those kind of minigames again in the sequels because of that, and it might also explain why they skipped this game and released Mario Party 2 for the Virtual Console.
